summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding an upcoming telephone conference in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. The order addresses the sealing of juror questionnaires and voir dire materials and instructs the parties to prepare for discussion and objections at the conference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, scheduling a conference, and providing instructions to the parties regarding jury selection materials.

events.title: Jury Selection Telephone Conference
events.description: A telephone conference scheduled by the court to discuss jury selection matters and logistics, including the sealing of juror questionnaires and voir dire.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan dated October 20, 2021, in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
A telephone conference was scheduled for October 21, 2021, to discuss jury selection logistics and the sealing of juror questionnaires and voir dire.
The court transmitted its draft questionnaire and draft voir dire to the parties via email for review prior to the conference.
The parties were instructed to be prepared to raise objections to the court's draft jury selection materials at the conference.
